snippet: Prime Minister Viktor Orban had proposed a constitutional amendment to stop a European Union program that would see the country accept migrants from the Middle East and Africa....
abstract: Hungarian lawmakers reject proposed national ban on refugees relocated from rest of European Union, dealing blow to Prime Min Viktor Orban; Hungary is slated to take in 1,294 migrants under European Union plan.

byline.original: By BALINT BARDI and PALKO KARASZ
byline.contributor: Balint Bardi reported from Budapest, and Palko Karasz from London.

lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Viktor Orban had proposed a constitutional amendment to stop a European Union program that would see the country accept migrants from the Middle East and Africa.

headline.main: Hungary’s Lawmakers Reject Plan to Block Resettlement of Refugees
headline.print_headline: Hungary’s Lawmakers Reject Bid to Block Migrants

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
